intro: Espeletia standleyana subsp. standleyana, commonly known as the "Páramo flower," is a striking plant native to the páramo ecosystems of northern South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and large, showy inflorescences that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, typically above 3,000 meters, where it adapts to cold and variable weather conditions. Its rosette structure helps it retain moisture and withstand strong winds. Espeletia standleyana subsp. standleyana plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the unique biodiversity of the páramo.
